result.execSummary:
The defendant Candra R. Rogers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misdemeanor Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Candra R. Rogers

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice indicating amount due mailed to defendant.

10:38 AM case called. Prosecuting Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Candra R. Rogers in court without counsel. Defendant advised of right to an attorney. Defendant wishes to proceed without counsel. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. 

Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 2: Misdemeanor Retail Theft-Intentionally Take (<=$500). Court accepts the plea and finds the defendant guilty.

Defendant makes statement.

Court orders costs, provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Conditions:
No contact with Festival Foods.

(11:26 AM case called.) Defendant Candra R. Rogers in court without counsel. Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint.
Defendant advised of right to an attorney. 
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on September 19, 2022 at 2:15 pm.
Hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions:
No contact with Festival Foods.
